H0.text: In the Hindu religion what name is given to the triad of chief gods Brahma, Vishnu and Siva. Trideva

H1.text: In the Hindu religion what name is given to the triad of chief gods Brahma, Vishnu and Siva. Brahmvishnusiva

H2.text: In the Hindu religion what name is given to the triad of chief gods Brahma, Vishnu and Siva. Hindu Trinity

H3.text: In the Hindu religion what name is given to the triad of chief gods Brahma, Vishnu and Siva. Trimurt

A4.text: The Trimurti is the triple deity of supreme divinity in Hinduism, in which the cosmic functions of creation, preservation, and destruction are personified as a triad of deities.

A5.text: The identification of Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva as one being is strongly emphasized in the Kūrma Purāṇa. In verse 1.6, Brahman is worshipped as Trimurti
